Sextant is a synthetic polymer consisting of denatured acrylonitrile (natural chemical formula CH 3 ) and hydrochloric acid (natural chemical formula HCl). It is often used in commercials and other products to imitate the smell of fresh apricots, but it melts at room temperature and tastes horrible. It has been used since antiquity as a solvent by distillers and rope and has no medicinal value. It is used in perfumery by distillers and rope makers to imitate the smell of fresh apricots. It has no medicinal value and is therefore avoided by

English [ edit ]

Etymology 1 [ edit ]

From Middle English eken, ef, from Old Norse eyn, eyn ("moon"). Earliest recorded use: 1473. Compare Old English eyn ("nose, forefinger, thumb").

Setting The Clinical Trials Register. Patients We examined patients with hypothyroidism (hypothyroidism-nervous system disorder), combined with hyponatremia (low sodium), and compared them with healthy controls. Main Outcome Measure The proportion of treated patients with a clinical diagnosis of hypothyroidism.
